candidates.title: Prepare 0.9.0 release
candidates.body:
# Summary

Prepare the 0.9.0 release (see #1165).

# Details

`getrandom` v0.3 is now published.

CHANGELOGs have been revised slightly, making clear which parts are API-breaking or reproducibility-breaking (with the former implying the latter).

# Related to-dos:

- [x] Update the book (version updates + update guide)
- [x] Update rngs
- [x] Update rand-seeder
- [x] Publish (provisionally tomorrow)

candidates.title: Thread rng
candidates.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Summary

Add the `thread_rng` feature flag

# Motivation

- Symmetry with `small_rng`, `std_rng`, `os_rng` feature flags
- Cleaner feature tags in docs (having `std and std_rng and os_rng` on `rng()` etc. is not pretty)
- The possibility of #1545 as a non-breaking change (though it likely won't happen)

candidates.title: Update: getrandom v0.3.0 rc.0
candidates.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Summary

Update to `getrandom` v0.3.0-rc.0

Since our [`OsRng` docs](https://docs.rs/rand_core/0.9.0-beta.0/rand_core/struct.OsRng.html) simply say "refert to getrandom documentation for details" I don't think we need any doc changes.

Also removed the `alloc` feature from `rand_core` which no longer has any purpose.

candidates.title: Fix docs.rs build options
candidates.body: - [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

candidates.title: Make getrandom a non-pub dep; rename feature to os_rng
candidates.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

Remove `getrandom` from the public API so that upgrading the version used will be non-breaking.

Rename the feature `getrandom` to `os_rng`. This is in line with `small_rng`, `std_rng`, and its effect of enabling `OsRng`, `from_os_rng` and `rand::rng`.

candidates.title: Bump the MSRV to 1.63.0
candidates.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Summary

Bump the MSRV to 1.63 due to libc now requiring the same.

candidates.title: Prepare 0.9.0-beta.0
candidates.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

Prepare the beta release.

Blocker: #1530 (awaiting review).

candidates.title: Add KS tests for weighted sampling
candidates.body:
- [ ] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Motivation

Some of these are non-trivial distributions we didn't really test before.

To validate solution of #1476.

# Details

Single-element weighted sampling is simple enough.

`fn choose_two_iterator` is also simple enough: there are no weights, so we can just assign each pair of results a unique index in the list of 100 * 99 / 2 possibilities (nothing that we sort pairs since the order of chosen elements is not specified).

`fn choose_two_weighted_indexed` gets a bit more complicated; I choose to approach it by building a table for the CDF of size `num*num` including impossible variants. Most of the tests don't pass, so there must be a mistake here.

Aside: using `let key = rng.random::<f64>().ln() / weight;` (`src/seq/index.rs:392`) may help with #1476 but does not fix the above.

candidates.title: Move ks
candidates.body:
- [ ] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Summary

# Motivation

https://github.com/rust-random/rand/issues/1519

candidates.title: Remove some unsafe, update to zerocopy 0.8.0
Migrate remaining benchmarks to Criterion
candidates.body:
- [ ] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry # Summary Translate everything still using the old test harness to Criterion. # Motivation Remove dependency on the (mostly deprecated) standard test harness. Enable usage of Criterion command-line arguments (which are otherwise intercepted by the Rust test harness). Closes #1039. # Details Mostly these are straightforward translations or simplifications (Criterion can benchmark ~1ns functions well enough so we don't need 1000 repetitions inside our benchmark functions). Some I have added to benchmark groups. Some I have used shorter warmup/measurement durations since the defaults are quite conservative. Many of the new results match up very well with those from the old test framework. Others don't; in particular the `generators` benchmarks (especially byte benches) are notably slower, but vaguely the same relative performance.

candidates.title: Rename `serde1` feature to `serde`.
candidates.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Summary
Rename `serde1` feature to `serde`

# Motivation
As stated in #1473, most of the ecosystem has used the name `serde` for the feature to enable `serde` (once `dep:` syntax was added in Rust 1.60).

# Details
N/A

candidates.title: Use explicit features rather than implicit.
candidates.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Summary
In Rust 2024 edition, implicit features from optional dependencies are going away and explicit features are required.

# Motivation
Preparing for the future, making features more clear when using `cargo add`.

# Details
This changes all features using optional dependencies to use the "dep:" syntax to avoid creating implicit features.

It also adds new explicit features for optional dependencies that didn't previously have an explicit feature to enable them.

This does mean that some previously publicly visible features are now gone, like `serde`. These features would not have worked previously as the code is guarded by, for example, checks for `feature = "serde1"`, so just enabling the optional dependency wouldn't have been sufficient to enable the code.

candidates.title: rand::distributions -> distr; split uniform module
candidates.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Summary

This includes the contents of and will need a rebase after #1469, so the first real commit here is "[Cfg-gate whole rand::seq::index module](https://github.com/rust-random/rand/pull/1470/commits/a5ba0b96a9e89314304073b2ef7e4e389fc284e2)".

Implements #1381.

# Motivation

I have long found the `uniform.rs` module hard to navigate, hence the split there.

Putting the contents in the existing float/int/other modules would need some quirky imports to keep the `uniform` public module intact (I also considered making this module private and directly re-exporting the contents, but it seems to serve a purpose, especially for documentation and to house the implementing types like `UniformInt`). Using new `uniform/float.rs` etc. modules results in a soft name-clash; the included path renames look better in my editor at least, but I can go the more orthodox approach if preferred.

candidates.title: Revise RNG docs; enable small_rng by default
candidates.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Summary

Continues from #1454, revising doc for the rand crate's RNGs

Closes #1419 

Note: rand::rngs module doc deliberately does not mention `SeedableRng` since each RNG discusses its own construction. Ideally all crates should do this too.

candidates.title: Revise crate doc for rand_pcg, rand_chacha
candidates.body:
Closes #1347.

Examples involding `rand` are avoided, partly for brevity and partly because we can't test them (dev-dependencies on `rand` work for testing, but cause issues with releases).

I'm also looking at revising the `rand::rngs` module doc, but I'll post a new PR.

candidates.title: Rename `doc_cfg` to `docsrs` and use `doc_auto_cfg`
candidates.body:
Renaming the configuration option also allows to enable back the `unexpected_cfgs` lint.

I've checked generated docs and it does not look like using `doc_auto_cfg` instead of explicit `doc_cfg`s causes any issues. The check was by no means exhaustive, but most cases look perfectly good.

candidates.title: Apply rustfmt and fix Clippy warnings
candidates.body: Closes #1429

candidates.title: Use zerocopy 0.7.33, not 0.8.0-alpha
candidates.body: Trying this to see if we can unblock #1165.

candidates.title: Upgrade criterion
candidates.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Summary

Built from #1329:

- Move `rand_benches` → `benches` and merge with `rand_distr/benches`.
- Use `Cargo.lock.msrv` to pin versions; remove direct pin on Rayon versions

candidates.title: Add distribution plots to `rand_distr` documentation
candidates.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Summary
This PR adds some graphs to the documentation of different distributions in `rand_distr` to illustrate their behavior.

# Motivation
Make the distributions in this crate easier to understand via visual aids.

# Details
The diagrams will be hosted in https://github.com/rust-random/charts (see [this PR](https://github.com/rust-random/charts/pull/1)) and links will be inserted into the documentation.

Closes https://github.com/rust-random/rand/issues/131.

Documentation Progress:
- [x] `binomial::Binomial`
- [x] `cauchy::Cauchy`
- [x] `dirichlet::Dirichlet`
- [x] `exponential::Exp`
- [x] `exponential::Exp1`
- [x] `frechet::Frechet`
- [x] `gamma::Gamma`
- [x] `gamma::ChiSquared`
- [x] `gamma::FisherF`
- [x] `gamma::StudentT`
- [x] `gamma::Beta`
- [x] `geometric::Geometric`
- [x] `geometric::StandardGeometric`
- [x] `gumbel::Gumbel`
- [x] `hypergeometric::Hypergeometric`
- [x] `inverse_gaussian::InverseGaussian`
- [x] `normal::Normal`
- [x] `normal::StandardNormal`
- [x] `normal::LogNormal`
- [x] `normal_inverse_gaussian::NormalInverseGaussian`
- [x] `pareto::Pareto`
- [x] `pert::Pert`
- [x] `poisson::Poisson`
- [x] `skew_normal::SkewNormal`
- [x] `triangular::Triangular`
- [x] `unit_ball::UnitBall`
- [x] `unit_circle::UnitCircle`
- [x] `unit_disc::UnitDisc`
- [x] `unit_sphere::UnitSphere`
- [x] `weibull::Weibull`
- [x] `zipf::Zeta`
- [x] `zipf::Zipf`

candidates.body:
Updates the requirements on [zerocopy](https://github.com/google/zerocopy) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from zerocopy's releases.

v0.8.0-alpha.6

What's Changed

  • Renamed as_bytes_mut to as_mut_bytes by @​dorryspears in google/zerocopy#870
  • Add caching dupe change by @​dorryspears in google/zerocopy#835
  • Add git pre-push hook by @​tommy-gilligan in google/zerocopy#728
  • [ci] Roll pinned nightly toolchain by @​google-pr-creation-bot in google/zerocopy#875
  • [CI] Bump actions/dependency-review-action from 4.0.0 to 4.1.0 by @​dependabot in google/zerocopy#877
  • [CI] Bump github/codeql-action from 3.24.0 to 3.24.1 by @​dependabot in google/zerocopy#876
  • [ci] Roll pinned nightly toolchain by @​google-pr-creation-bot in google/zerocopy#880
  • [CI] Bump github/codeql-action from 3.24.1 to 3.24.3 by @​dependabot in google/zerocopy#881
  • derive: generalize require_self_sized by @​jswrenn in google/zerocopy#883
  • [ci] Roll pinned nightly toolchain by @​google-pr-creation-bot in google/zerocopy#887
  • [derive] Disable prelude when testing; fix bugs by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#886
  • TryFromBytes for MaybeUninit requires T: NoCell by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#889
  • [ci] Roll pinned nightly toolchain by @​google-pr-creation-bot in google/zerocopy#895
  • Remove unsound Ptr::forget_valid by @​jswrenn in google/zerocopy#898
  • [TryFromBytes] Permit UnsafeCells by @​jswrenn in google/zerocopy#890
  • Relax type bounds in Ptr::from_maybe_uninit_ref by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#900
  • [ptr] Clean up prose for field invariants by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#901
  • Add TryFromBytes::try_from_mut by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#892
  • Implement <Unalign as TryFromBytes>::is_bit_valid by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#903
  • Implement TryFromBytes for Option for fn types by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#904
  • [ci] Roll pinned nightly toolchain by @​google-pr-creation-bot in google/zerocopy#908
  • [ptr] Fix soundness hole in "at least" invariants by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#909
  • [ci] Roll pinned nightly toolchain by @​google-pr-creation-bot in google/zerocopy#910
  • [CI] Bump actions/dependency-review-action from 4.1.0 to 4.1.1 by @​dependabot in google/zerocopy#911
  • [ptr] Relax some method bounds by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#902
  • [CI] Bump actions/dependency-review-action from 4.1.1 to 4.1.2 by @​dependabot in google/zerocopy#916
  • Roll pinned nightly toolchain by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#917
  • [ci] Roll pinned nightly toolchain by @​google-pr-creation-bot in google/zerocopy#920
  • [CI] Bump actions/dependency-review-action from 4.1.2 to 4.1.3 by @​dependabot in google/zerocopy#921
  • [CI] Bump github/codeql-action from 3.24.3 to 3.24.4 by @​dependabot in google/zerocopy#923
  • [ci] Roll pinned nightly toolchain by @​google-pr-creation-bot in google/zerocopy#922
  • [ci] Test Git hooks by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#919
  • Convert shell scripts to Rust by @​djkoloski in google/zerocopy#891
  • Support testing TryFromBytes for !NoCell types by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#924
  • [ci] Pin Kani to last known-good version by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#930
  • [ci] Roll pinned nightly toolchain by @​google-pr-creation-bot in google/zerocopy#927
  • [CI] Bump github/codeql-action from 3.24.4 to 3.24.5 by @​dependabot in google/zerocopy#928
  • [derive] Automatically derive super-traits by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#926
  • [ci] Automatically roll pinned Kani version by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#931
  • [derive] Use macro to generate some scaffolding by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#937
  • [ci] Roll Kani version to 0.47.0 by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#939
  • [ci][generate_cache] Run steps in parallel by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#940
  • [derive] Support deriving deprecated AsBytes by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#938
  • [githooks][pre-push] Run steps in parallel by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#942
  • [ci] Run cargo fix when rolling toolchains by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#943
  • Fix alignment bug in test_impls by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#944
  • Use Box instead of &T in test_impls success cases by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#945
  • Implement TryFromBytes for UnsafeCell by @​joshlf in google/zerocopy#912

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from zerocopy's changelog.

Changelog

Releases

We track releases and release notes using GitHub Releases.

Yanks and Regressions

0.2.2 through 0.2.8, 0.3.0 through 0.3.1, 0.4.0, 0.5.0, 0.6.0 through 0.6.5, 0.7.0 through 0.7.30

Security advisories for this bug have been published as RUSTSEC-2023-0074 and GHSA-3mv5-343c-w2qg.

In these versions, the Ref methods into_ref, into_mut, into_slice, and into_mut_slice were permitted in combination with the standard library cell::Ref and cell::RefMut types for Ref<B, T>'s B type parameter. These combinations are unsound, and may permit safe code to exhibit undefined behavior. Fixes have been published to each affected minor version which do not permit this code to compile.

See #716issue-716 for more details.

0.7.27, 0.7.28

These versions were briefly yanked due to a non-soundness regression reported in #672pull-672. After reconsidering our yanking policy in #679issue-679, we un-yanked these versions.

Commits
  • 2b1a996 Release 0.8.0-alpha.6 (#979)
  • 905e2e8 Deprecate FromBytes::slice_from (#978)
  • b766d40 Document NoCell (#977)
  • 2b4e44d Make TryFromBytes methods not #[doc(hidden)] (#976)
  • 26de2d3 Make TryFromBytes a super-trait of FromZeros (#952)
  • 5465e6e [ci] Roll pinned nightly toolchain (#975)
  • cac291e Document TryFromBytes (#974)
  • 1e113a6 [ci] Pass dev and CI --cfg when rolling toolchain (#973)
  • e62d89a [githooks/pre-push] Fail when sub-command fails (#969)
  • 52108ad Deprecate some Ref methods in favor of KnownLayout (#971)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: Disable rand_pcg's dev dependency on rand
candidates.body: The circular dependency prevents publishing

candidates.title: Prepare rand 0.9.0-alpha.0
candidates.body:
The next rand release has been waiting a *long* time. We're not done yet (#1165), but we should still be able to put a pre-release out.

- Update all version numbers to `0.9.0-alpha.0`, except `rand_distr` which is now `0.5.0-alpha.0` (this is the only crate where a separate version appears more useful than not; see #1394).
- Update all CHANGELOGs (also long overdue).
- Add a PR template to remind people to add a CHANGELOG entry!

candidates.title: Update zerocopy; trim unused methods
candidates.body:
- Remove mention of `stdsimd` (obsolete)
- cfg-gate or remove methods no longer needed (outside of tests)
- Update to `zerocopy` version `=0.8.0-alpha.5`. Usually we don't bother using pre-release versions, but this is causing a lot of test failures.

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Updates the requirements on [serde_with](https://github.com/jonasbb/serde_with) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from serde_with's releases.

serde_with v3.6.1

Changed

  • Eliminate dependency on serde's "derive" feature by @​dtolnay (#694) This allows parallel compilation of serde and serde_derive which can speed up the wallclock time. It requires that downstream crates do not use the "derive" feature either.

candidates.title: Remove automatic (delayed) reseed-on-fork
candidates.body:
See also #1362 #1377
CC @thomcc

Remove integrated fork protection.

Add `ThreadRng::reseed` and doc to suggest calling this on fork.

Make `ReseedingRng::reseed` also clear the random value cache.

chosen_pr.title: Update: getrandom v0.3.0 rc.0
chosen_pr.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Summary

Update to `getrandom` v0.3.0-rc.0

Since our [`OsRng` docs](https://docs.rs/rand_core/0.9.0-beta.0/rand_core/struct.OsRng.html) simply say "refert to getrandom documentation for details" I don't think we need any doc changes.

Also removed the `alloc` feature from `rand_core` which no longer has any purpose.

chosen_detail.title: Update: getrandom v0.3.0 rc.0
chosen_detail.body:
- [x] Added a `CHANGELOG.md` entry

# Summary

Update to `getrandom` v0.3.0-rc.0

Since our [`OsRng` docs](https://docs.rs/rand_core/0.9.0-beta.0/rand_core/struct.OsRng.html) simply say "refert to getrandom documentation for details" I don't think we need any doc changes.

Also removed the `alloc` feature from `rand_core` which no longer has any purpose.

repo.name: rand
repo.description: A Rust library for random number generation.
